title: Government of South Tyrol
text:
The Government of South Tyrol (; ) is the chief <a href="Executive%20%28government%29">executive</a> body of the <a href="Autonomous%20administrative%20division">autonomous</a> <a href="Provinces%20of%20Italy">province</a> of <a href="South%20Tyrol">South Tyrol</a> in northern <a href="Italy">Italy</a> enforcing the provincial laws as written by the <a href="Landtag%20of%20South%20Tyrol">Landtag</a> legislature. The government has its seat in the capital city of <a href="Bolzano">Bolzano</a>/Bozen.
The local government system is based upon the provisions of the <a href="Constitution%20of%20Italy">Italian Constitution</a> and the Autonomy Statute of the Region <a href="Trentino-Alto%20Adige/S%C3%BCdtirol">Trentino-Alto Adige/Südtirol</a>. The "Landesregierung" is headed by a <a href="governor">governor</a>, referred to as "<a href="Landeshauptmann">Landeshauptmann</a>" ("State Captain") in German (Italian: "Presidente della Giunta Provinciale"). The members of the government are elected in a secret ballot by an <a href="absolute%20majority">absolute majority</a> in the Landtag, traditionally dominated by the <a href="South%20Tyrolean%20People%27s%20Party">South Tyrolean People's Party</a> (SVP). However, the composition of the <a href="cabinet%20%28government%29">cabinet</a> has to reflect the proportion of the German, Italian and <a href="Ladin%20language">Ladin</a> language groups. The current <a href="coalition%20government">coalition government</a> formed by the SVP and the <a href="Democratic%20Party%20%28Italy%29">Democratic Party</a> is headed by <a href="Arno%20Kompatscher">Arno Kompatscher</a> (SVP).
The <a href="Civic%20Network%20of%20South%20Tyrol">Civic Network of South Tyrol</a> is the government's official internet website, serving for <a href="e-Government">e-Government</a> and public administration.
